sentences.en: I am pregnant. I waddle awkwardly, my big stomach pressed against the weight of the world.
sentences.cn: 我怀孕了, 我滑稽可笑地瞒珊而行, 大肚子上压着全世界的重量.

sentences.en: In the evenings, ducks waddle up to the front door to be fed.
sentences.cn: 傍晚时分，鸭子们摇摇摆摆地来到前门进食。

sentences.en: It was very funny the way in which the penguins to waddle.
sentences.cn: 企鹅走路的样子真是滑稽可笑.

sentences.en: It was very funny the way in which the penguins used to waddle.
sentences.cn: 企鹅走路的那样子真是滑稽.

sentences.en: Stand so still while they waddle my way.
sentences.cn: 他们摇摇摆摆朝我走来时,我站着不动.

sentences.en: Their synchronized waddle could have caused the bridge to oscillate, leading even more of them tandem.
sentences.cn: 他们步调一致的来回走动可能导致了前禧桥的振荡, 这又使得这些行人的步伐更加的一致.

sentences.en: This may mean having to part with a waddle of cash.
sentences.cn: 这可能意味着一大笔钱将离开你.

sentences.en: To walk with a clumsy sway ; waddle.
sentences.cn: 鸭子 摇摇晃晃 地走进池塘.

sentences.en: We waddle and hop and have lots of fun.
sentences.cn: 我们走起路来摇摇摆摆,还一跳一跳的.我们的生活很有趣.

words.tran_cn: 摇摇摆摆地走；蹒跚而行

trans.tran_en: to walk with short steps, with your body moving from one side to another – used especially about people or birds with fat bodies and short legs
